sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 1.2 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description: Thing Stardate:: 5428.8 Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The Hudson's away team managed to deactivate the subspace distortion wave using the control room inside one of Bacchus' spires. Meanwhile, a Klingon Bird of Prey, The IKR Ya'Leth, fell out of warp completely deactivated much like the Hudson before.Deactivating the subspace wave triggers a security response, and the machinery in the planet began to rip apart the other planets in the solar system. The Hudson's crew assisted the Ya'Leth to eject their warp core, now resonating with the same subspace distortions as the planet.After escaping the Bacchus system, astronomers watched in horror and amazement as the entire Bacchus-3 system pulled itself apart, pulling inwards towards a singularity, and disappeared.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 2 - Orion Heist
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-2.description: Stardate:: 5557.6 Mission:: The Orion Heist Note:: Admiral Banna Stoker sent the crew of the USS Hudson to recover a stolen Tilikaal artifact. The crew tracked the artifact down to the SS Tardigrade, an Orion trade ship, and convinced them to hand over the artifact before their Romulan liaison arrived. Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Stoker took the artifact to study further.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-3.title: Hudson Log 3 - Phantoms Adrift
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-3.description: Stardate:: 5591.2 Mission:: Phantoms Adrift Note:: While delivering an encrypted message from Captain Alder to Captain Skaarsen, a trusted friend of Alder's, Commander Lodge and Lieutenant Tiaun encountered an 50 year old derelict Starfleet starship drifting out of on ion Nebula. There, an unknown species attempted to escape the wreckage by disguising themselves as copies of Lodge and Tiaun. The two real officers escaped the derelict ship and delivered the message, leaving a report with Starfleet to take care of the derelict ship and the strange entities there.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.title: Hudson Log 4.1 - The Pasqual Problem
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.description: Stardate:: 5697.6 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: While preparing to perform a deep space scan of the Shackleton Expanse, the Hudson encountered a starfleet shuttle with Admiral Bana Stoker on board. Stoker ordered the Hudson to head directly towards the Pasqual system, which had previously been unscanned. There, an away team was sent to investigate Pasqual-1, an M-class planet with a thick electromagnetic field surrounding it.The planet was inhabited by a variety of intelligent humanoid people that appear to be of many different species, but without any sort of advanced technology. The away team, led by Commander Lodge and joined by Jolepo, Verid, Doctor Suvak, and Ensign Tak avoided contact with the locals. They got beamed off the planet after 24 hours with film photographs and recorded observations.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.title: Hudson Log 4.2 - The Pasqual Problem
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.description:
Please make an account on The Forge (link in discord channel). Let me know if you have any difficulties with the new tools! Try rolling on a couple character sheets and the ship Look in the "Journals" tab in the top right. Check out the mission logs format and some of the other notes. Find your character token on the ship rooms page and try moving them around a bit! Test out some of the macros. There's a couple techobabble macros and one for using the "fire" action in ship combat! I feel the following supporting characters are eligible for advancement! If I've forgotten someone who deserves it, please nominate them! Tak - @ Kelly
Roger Quincy @ John
Astrid Alder @ Dan
Kyle Miller @ Jeff Each of these characters can do one of the following (take note of which one you choose): Add a new Value (up to four times) Increase an attribute by 1 (one time only) Increase a department by 1 (one time only) Add a new focus (up to three times) Add a new Talent (up to four times) Supporting Character advancement is on page 146 (also below). Supporting characters can also be advanced further using your Milestones.
Stardate:: 5697.6
Mission:: Simplicity Note:: The Hudson was attacked by a Klingon D7 battle cruiser, which demanded custody of Admiral Stoker. The Hudson barely managed to avoid any serious harm before disabling the Klingon ship. Captain Astrid Alder attempted to liaison with the Klingons, but they demanded death in combat and would not surrender. Commander Lodge and Doctor Suvok convinced the Klingon Captain to let them on board to tend to their wounded, based on giving the Klingons a fair fight.Back on the Hudson, Lt. Cmdr. Jolepo and Lt. Verid refitted an atmospheric probe to enter the electromagnetic field of Pasqual-1. While performing a sensor sweep of the obelisk there, the probe was uploaded with thousands of years of genetic survey results. Each survey was paired was an "genetic advancement attempt", the results and purpose of which are still unclear.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-5.title: Hudson Log 5 - Aboard the Klingon Ship
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-5.description: Stardate:: 5697.6 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: Sukav, Robert Lodge, Valerie, and Tak beamed aboard the IKR Ya'leth on the pretense of offering medical aid. Their real mission was to figure out what the Klingons wanted with Admiral Stoker. The Klingon crew members seemed to be as irritated and confused about the situation as the crew of the Hudson. Their captain had kept the purpose of their mission secret, much like Admiral Stoker. However, the captain of the Klingon ship was soon forced to admit he and Stoker were after a weapon of incredible power. As the Klingon Crew mutinied, the Hudson away team left to confront Stoker. The Admiral ordered the Hudson to destroy the Klingon ship, but captain Astrid Alder had Stoker arrested instead.
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-5.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Hudson/Shared/Sessions/Summaries/Season 1/Hudson Log 5 - Aboard the Klingon Ship.md

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-6.title: Hudson Log 6 - Border Dispute
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-6.description: Stardate:: 5764.8 Mission:: Border Dispute Note:: The USS Hudson was summoned to rescue the USS Nightingale, a Federation science vessel which had drifted unexpectedly into the neutral zone. There, a Romulan bird of prey was claiming the crewmembers as prisoners of war. The Hudson quickly engaged the Romulan warbird and nearly disabled it while an evacuation team attempted to get survivors off the Nightingale. In the end, a Romulan disguised as a Vulcan, named T'lek attempted to return to the bird of prey but was fired upon. When T'lek sought refuge on the Hudson, they were quickly found to be a spy and arrested. It's still unclear what information T'lek was trying to give to the Romulans.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-7.title: Hudson Log 7 - Investigation
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-7.description: Stardate:: 5798.4 Mission:: Order in Court Note:: With the Hudson docked for the duration of Admiral Banna Stoker's court martial trial, the crew took some time to collect information on the Tilikaal artifact and the effect it may have had the admiral. In the end, they found a subliminal message of mental domination embedded in the artifact's subspace distress signal. Meanwhile, Commander Lodge followed leads of civilian trade of Tilikaal artifacts and opened civilian passage to systems previously blocked by Admiral Stoker.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-8.title: Hudson Log 8 - Court Martial
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-8.description: Stardate:: 5832 Mission:: Order in Court Note:: Admiral Banna Stoker was put on trial for a court martial. Commander Robert H. Lodge lead the prosecution on the request of Captain Alder. Defense Attorney Samuel T Cogley.Ahead of the trial, Jolepo and Verid investigated some of Admiral Stoker's history on the station, in particular the discharge of her son, Avery, a science officer aboard Narendra Station. They discovered that Admiral Stoker had suspected a Starfleet coverup regarding the Tilikaal and used her position to conduct a private investigation into the Subspace frequencies in the Washboard and their origin.Lodge argued through witness testimony that the Admiral had acted recklessly with her authority, and her removal from command was necessary to avoid prime directive violation and potential flashpoints leading to war with the Klingons. Cogley argued that the Admiral had acted within her rights in the chain of command and according to Starfleet values to provide assistance to a people in need.Finally, when Lodge offered into evidence the fact that Stoker may have been telepathically manipulated through the Tilikaal artifact, the tribunal ruled to acquit Stoker of charges, but reassigned her to a position far away from the Shackleton Expanse where her condition can be monitored.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-9.title: Hudson Log 9 - Convention
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-9.description: Stardate:: 5865.6 Mission:: Convention Note:: Science Officer Kassandra Pruitt went missing while investigating some of the system survey data recovered from T'Lek. Since Starfleet suspected Romulan involvement, Starfleet organized a convention to lure Pruitt's abductors. The bait would be several more Starfleet officers with connections to T'Lek and Admiral Stoker from the USS Hudson.The Delegations from the Romulans, Klingons, Orions, and many Federation worlds were invited to demonstrate their scientific and technological advancements. The members of the Hudson followed several leads, including a few Orions and a Klingon thief.A human trader named Cyrano Jones was peddling a Tilikaal dagger at the convention, and caught he attention of a Romulan Sub-Commander named Thalvaek, and a couple Orions. However, Jolepo was able to buy the dagger from Jones first. This lead to a Romulan named Sarren to attempted kidnapping Jolepo, but was unsuccessful. In a gambit to find out more of the the Romulan plans and form a stronger relationship, Sukav met with subcommander Thal'vaek with an offer to sell a Tilikaal dagger. He was not seen at the convention again, but was given a tracking device that saw him brought into the Romulan Empire.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 10.1 - Abyss Station
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 5899.2 Mission:: Abyss Station Note:: Attempting to rescue Sukav, the Hudson chased a Romulan bird of prey to a black hole with a neutronium lined space station and a singular rocky planet orbiting it. The planet had strange cultist gazing at the black hole waiting for the day it would "gaze back". The black hole was rotating to annihilate the planet with its radiation jets. On the strange alien station, an away team tried to rescue Sukav.After a week of watching Sukav's tracking device linger in Romulan space, he was suddenly moved past Narendra station and into the Shackleton Expanse. The Hudson gave chase, pushing it's warp nacelles to ride over the washboard effect and catch up to the Romulan bird of prey.They found the bird of prey at a system orbiting a black hole, dubbed the Omega Draconis system. There, they found single rocky planet with no atmosphere but a series of underground structures about approximately 300 life signs. There was also a large space station made of obsidian black neutronium. The Romulans had taken Sukav, Lt Pruitt, and two Starfleet ensign s into the alien space station.As the Hudson arrived, the black hole suddenly seemed to rotate. Massive high powered radiation jets moved to expel along the galactic plane. The planet, and all ~300 people on it, stood to be annihilated. One away team went down to the planet to start an evacuation, while another went into the space station to recover Sukav and hopefully find out what caused the block hole to change orientation.The team on the planet found a small group of pale humanoids with space travel capabilities but no warp capability. They spoke about how they had spent a very long gazing into the abyss waiting for the time when the abyss would gaze back at them. They seemed unconcerned about the radiation jets.Meanwhile, a rescue team infiltrated the alien space station. Inside, they found large and humanoid-shaped automatons and a series of passageways leading into the center of the station. At the center, they found the Romulans working in a control center and the Starfleet officers tied up in the middle of the room. The rescue team ambushed the Romulans and engaged in the firefight. Kyle Miller and Tizia were each wounded by disruptor fire, leaving only Verid to fend off the remaining 5 Romulans.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 10.2 - Abyss Station Part 2
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 5899.2 Mission:: Abyss Station Note:: Verid and Sukav made the ultimate sacrifice to destroy Abyss Station, so that no one can use it again. On the planet, Nisha and Tak left the cultists on the service, unable to break them from their faith.On the planet, Nisha spoke to the colony's leader, Akkara and attempted to convince them to evacuate the planet. Tak quickly collected as much about this people as they could, to preserve the historical record. Although Nisha was able to provide ample evidence that the planet and everyone on it would be destroyed, Akkara's faith that the Abyss would spare them was too great. In the end, the black hole's radiation jets obliterated the planet after the Hudson's crew evacuated.Meanwhile, Verid, Sukav, Astrid, and Kyle Miller dispatched the Romulans. Astrid sustained severe disruptor burns but Sukav stabilized her. Verid and Sukav worked together to operate the station, which seemed to be controlling the black hole. The controls implied the black hole was capable of generating a wormhole, through with the black hole itself or the radiation jets would be able to annihilate anything at the coordinates. The Romulans had set the coordinates at the Klingon homeworld, Qo'Nos.Ultimately, Verid and Sukav resolved that the station had to be destroyed so that the Romulans, nor even the Federation, could return to it. Without a way to communicate with the Hudson, they stayed behind and used the controls to create a singularity inside the station itself. The new singularity engulphed the station, Verid, and Sukav.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 11.1 - Crystal Clear
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56030 Mission:: Imminent Collision Note:: The Hudson encountered a strange crystalline starship, and attempted to remove a torpedo from it, but ended up causes more damage. When they returned to Narendra Station, they found over 100 years had passed during their time at the black hole. Several members decide to either leave Starfleet or transfer to new positions. They rest of the long lost crew of the Hudson would continue their adventures in the Shackleton Expanse.After Abyss Station was destroyed by a new singularity, the USS Hudson left the Omega Draconis system towards Narendra station. The Hudson held a vigil for the lost members of the crew, Verid and Sukav. On the way back to Narendra Station, they found the stars and systems around them had moved much further in time than anticipated, about 110 years.On the way back, the Hudson encountered a strange crystalline ship attempting to communicate through light. An away team with Robert Lodge, Jolepo, Tizia, and Nisha beamed aboard the starship. They found a crystalline species, who led them to a unidentified torpedo embedded into the crystal walls of the ship.The torpedo was still active, and the attempts to remove it went awry. Jolepo and Tizia evacuated out into space through a hole in the hull, while Robert and Nisha took cover behind a door. A large section of the starship shattered like glass, and it fled soon afterwards.The Hudson continued to Narendra station, where they found that much had changed. The alliance between the Federation had strengthened, but not without some strife. General Kargan was still in command of the station, now approaching almost 200 years old. He had limited and controlled exploration of the Shackleton Expanse over the last 100 years, fearing the fate of his old counterpart, Banna Stoker. Now, a new Admiral joined Kargan from the Federation: Admiral April Hebert.After welcoming the crew of the Hudson back to Narendra Station, April invited them to take some time off to find their new place in the world. Robert Lodge would go on to become a historian, looking into the events of the past 100 years. And Astrid Alder would take some time off to consider new options in Starfleet. In the meantime, Narendra Station would provide an interim commanding officer and supplementary crew along with a Galaxy Class starship named in the Hudson's honor.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 12 - Pasqual's Progress
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56052 Mission:: Pasqual's Progress Note:: Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the new USS Hudson-B on a short survey mission aboard the Hudson's yacht. They visited Pasqual-1, and found the society there advancing rapidly though technological ages on their own. The people of Pasqual had embark on a century long project to go to space. An away team found a single neutronium obelisk left on the planet, which seemed to have some sort of influence on the people there.Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the USS Hudson on a survey mission aboard the captain's yacht, the USS Portland. They planned to visit Pasqual-1 on a routine survey mission, and follow that up with a visit to the Lilifas system.They found that the Pasqual-1 population had been speed-running their technological advancement. In just 110 years, they've reached the equivalent of earth's information age (already a time known for accelerated advances in technology.) After Jolepo expressed interest in visiting the planet, Captain Scriba agreed. Scriba, Jolepo, Jaro, and Delisle all went down, leaving Nisha and Tizia on the yacht.On the planet, the away team found a society with a singular focus: get into space. The people there had correctly deduced that the monoliths Starfleet removed we taken from them, and their entire culture had been driven to reach out to know what else was out there.The away team decided to find something like a library, and got directions to something the people there called repository. People there seemed to expect the away team to speak openly and constantly about what new projects and research they were working on. At the repository, the away team sought out information on the black neutronium monoliths that were removed from the planet over the last 100 years. What they found was a history of people quicky devising that someone from off world must have taken the obelisks, and that space-travel must be possible.In the repository, a weekly ideas-sharing session was held, where all in attendance were required to share their research and progress. In the middle of this atrium, a silo opened up, and one of the black monoliths rose up from below. Lieutenant Delisle felt a presence of malicious patience coming from within the silo. Jolepo scanned the area during the meeting and found a subspace signal with a some sort of sublimal messaging in it, similar to the artifact that influenced Admiral Banna Stoker 110 years ago.Jolepo presented on an energy-efficient waste-disposal system for a colony ship, which avoided any suspicion that they may be from off world. Once the meeting was over, the away team was able to find a place to be alone and beam off planet unnoticed.Before reporting back to Starfleet, the crew of the USS Portland also visited the second planet on their itinerary: Lilifas. Here, they did a survey on the pre-warp civilization below. Video footage revealed a species of centaur-like otter people with age-of-sail technology. While observing Lilifas, a tractor beam from the planet grabbed asteroid orbiting in a ring around the planet, and threw it towards the USS Portland. Lt. Nisha was able to dodge the rocks. The USS Portland then returned to Narendra station, with plans to recover the 1 monolith remaining on Pasqual-1.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 13.1 - Pasqual's Past
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56073 Mission:: Pasqual's Past Note:: Admiral Hebert gave Captain Scriba permission to make first contact with the people of Pasqual-1. There, the Pasqualese were in a frenzy trying to learn as much about Starfleet technology as possible. But in their extended visit, Jaro made a dark secret buried beneath the repository: A borg queen.Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Hebert and General Kargan met with the bridge crew of the USS Hudson to discuss what to do about the civilization on the Pasqual system. They decided, much to General Kargan's dismay, that the Federation would make first contact with the Pasqualese. Captain Scriba made this contact by connecting to the planet's global communications network and announcing the Hudson's presence and intentions of peace. The planet's activity spiked there was a frenzy of communications on the planet. But before long, the Pasquallese sent a delegation to meet with the crew of the Hudson.The delegation was amazed by Stafleet technology, particularly interested in their warp technology, transporters, and replicators. After introductions were made, Captain Scriba made arrangements to start sharing Federation technology with them as a gesture of peace.The Hudson stayed at the Pasqual system for an extended time, and the crew spent plenty of time on and around the planet communicating with an teaching the Pasqualese about what it's like to be in the Federation. Delisle in particular learned that the Pasqualese depended on their biological distinctiveness and diversity to surive, each person contributing to the whole. This led to a culture that strongly valued cooperation and sharing.Delisle also picked up aa constant feeling of anxiety from the people of Pasqual-1. As if they weren't telling the Hudson and crew everything.Meanwhile, Jaro was lead below the obelisk and met a borg queen, and told to repair the transwarp drive. There, he came face to face with some sort of Borg head in a jar. It awoke and said, "Greetings."

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 13.2 - The Proto-Borg
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56091 Mission:: Pasqual's Progress Note:: The crew of the Hudson learned that the org believed itself to be a creation of the Tilikaal. Thinking the Borg was too much of a threat, the crew killed the "Borg queen" and calledi n the Federation, who occupied the planet briefly to remove all possible borg and Tilikaal influence on the planet.Below the repository, Jaro spoke with the Borg, learning that it had arrived thousands of years ago and was forced to remain dormant while the planet's electromagnetic field was active. But in the past 100 years, it had awoken and was using the Tilikaal monolith to influence and guide to people of Pasqual-1.The Borg "Queen" talked about being a creation of the Tilikaal, and that its mission was to travel the stars in search of them. It claimed that once it found the Tilikaal, perfect beings, it could finally assimilate them to become as perfect as they are.After a great deal of debate and further investiation the Hudson's crew decided to kill the Borg queen. But the Borg queen controlled the assimilated skeletons left over in the small Borg ship and defended herself. When the last of the guard were neutralized, the Borg queen begged for it's life. But Jolepo executed it.Starfleet and a compliment of Klingon battleships arrived on Pasqual and occupied it. There was a full sweep of the planet and find and root out and Borg technology. It took weeks. The Tilikaal monolith was excavated and removed from the planet also.While the people of Pasqual-1 now had a great leap in technology, they were left with a disdain for the Federation.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 14 - The Qofuari Conundrum
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56107 Mission:: The Qofuari Conundrum Note:: The Hudson responded to a distress call from a population of futurists on a planet where advanced technology was illegal to develop. After deliberating over the demands of the Prime Directive, the Hudson took many of the futurists aboard to bring back to Narendra Station.The Hudson responded to a distress call from a Pre-Warp at the Lilifas system. They got in touch with a group of local Qofuari calling themselves the Future Builders. They claimed they were being held captive on their planet because development of advanced technology was illegal, despite their ability to do so.The Hudson got in touch with the planet's local authorities and spent time learning about the Qofuari and their culture. They were a fairly tribal people, but had managed to enforce this law globally due to matching cultural values. The Qofuari had also been evolved from Tilikaal monoliths similar to the Pasqualese, but at some point had managed to disassemble the monoliths themselves. The existence of the monoliths seemed to have been impetus for the laws against technology in the first placeIn the end, the Hudson agreed to take aboard the Future builders and bring them back to Narendra Station, taking them away from their home planet.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 15 - Fading Sun
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56127 Mission:: Fading Suns Note:: The Hudson visited the starbase Epsilon 19, where energy parasites from a nearby star had caused several major explosions. The crew managed to restore power and capture or kill the parasites. An Orion woman named Helestia was arrested for stealing scientific equipment in the confusion.The Hudson was assigned to deliver scientific equipment the small Epsilon 19 starbase at the Osarin system. The Starbase was studying a fading star, where the energy seemed to be disappearing. While aboard the station, Captain Scriba, Jolepo, and Doctor T'Lor got dinner with the station's commanding officer, Commander Johansson. At dinner, they met an Orion woman named Helestia Baenor, who had brought a number of luxuries to the station as gifts to thank the officers for allowing her crew to rest at the station. Meanwhile, the Hudson left to go study the nearby starAfter getting a tour of the station, Scriba, Jolepo, and T'Lor were aboard a turbolift with station science officer Mosa, when the station suffered a massive explosion at several points. T'Lor was able to stabilize Mosa, and they all climbed the turbolift shaft to a medical bay. There, they discovered the source of triolic radiation emanating from the engineering section, the same radiation emanating from the nearby star.In engineering, they discovered Baenor had turned off power output to the rest of the station, which had inadvertently lead to the explosion. Scriba left to pursue and arrest her. On the station's nuclear fusion reactor, Jolepo found strange energy parasite creatures out of phase in time. He used his phaser to bring them back into phase and caught several of them, but others escaped into Jefferies Tubes. By this point, power was restored to the station, and security teams could be organized to hunt down these strange creatures. The station would later be given better shielding to prevent infection from the local start, where the Hudson had discovered the parasites breeding.Helestia Baenor was arrested and found with Starfleet science equipment aboard her ship. She claimed to be attempting to rescue the equipment and prevent it from becoming damaged in the exploding starbase. She would be brought to Narendra Station for trial.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 16.1 - Convoy SE-119
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Stardate:: 56168 Mission:: Convoy SE-119 Note:: The Hudson and Klingon ship Mupwl' escorted a convoy to a new colony location in the Shackleton Expanse. Along the way, the Mupwl' was disabled by subspace eddies and the convoy atted by pirated calling themselves "Vinshari"Both the Mupwl' and Hudson were in Narendra station undergoing minor refits, repairs, and maintenance. Akarra asked captain to help convince Kargan to approve a colonization effort in the Shackleton expanse. The Hudson would provide cover for the convpy along with Akkara's IKS Mupwl'. Kargan reluctantly agreed.Along the way, the convoy headed through a region of the Expanse with strange subspace eddies in the washboard. Unlike the usual background turbulence of the washboard subspace waves.In these eddies, the Mupwl' suffered a sudden explosion in one of their warp nacelles, and comms were disrupted by the eddies as well. While the Hudson tried to make contact and organize repair teams, two unidentified ships with sails and masts appeared on the sensors, seemingly being "behind" the subspace eddies.The unidentified ships demanded the Hudson and Mupwl' had over their warp cores because "Power is our right." and attacked soon after. On the viewscreen, the enemies identified themselves as Vinshari and had bright red skin, with collar bones that rose out of the skin and flanked their necks like cape collars.The Hudson positioned itself to protect the convoy ships, and the Vinshari ships deployed a dozen small single fighters. Commander Jaro as able to modulate the Hudson's shields to crush half the fighters in a subspace eddy, which also collapsed the eddy itself.One of the larger Vinshari ships attacked the disabled Mupwl' and another tried to deal with the Hudson, while the remaining small fighters maneuvered to intercept the freighters. The Vinshari ships had difficulty piercing the Hudson's shields with their physical ammunition. And have since maneuvered around them to focus on the freighters.

uss-hudson-b.html.title: USS Hudson-B
uss-hudson-b.html.description:
Summary Location:: The Shackleton Expanse
Portrait:: Note:: The NCC-7832-B: A exploration and diplomatic exchange ship set to explore the Shackleton Expanse.
A Federation Galaxy Class starship commanded by Edward Scriba. Federation Starship Galaxy Class Survivor of Dominion War The USS Hudson-B has been assigned to explore the Shackleton Expanse on the far side of the Klingon and Romulan empires. The Galaxy Class starship has been refit for service as an exploratory vessel after previously serving in the Dominion war. During the refit of the Hudson-B, the previously assumed lost USS Hudson-A reemerged from the Shackleton. Many members of the USS Hudson-A have been reassigned to the Hudson-B. The USS Hudson will be based out of Narendra Station, a deep space research station jointly run by Starfleet and the Klingon Empire.Season 1
Hudson Log 1.1 - Arrival at Bacchus-3: Stardate 5428.8, Session: 1
The USS Hudson-B arrived Bacchus-3, falling victim to a total power failure tripped by a massive subspace distortion. The subspace waves prevent long range communication and warp travel. They were found to be originated on Bacchus-3. An away team was put together to investigate the planet and hopefully deactivate whatever is causing the waves. On the planet, several Federation members were found, studying massive monoliths reaching into the upper atmosphere. The Hudson's away team was able to open a door on the monolith, revealing passageways inside.
Hudson Log 1.2 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call: Stardate 5428.8, Session: 2The Hudson's away team managed to deactivate the subspace distortion wave using the control room inside one of Bacchus' spires. Meanwhile, a Klingon Bird of Prey, The IKR Ya'Leth, fell out of warp completely deactivated much like the Hudson before.Deactivating the subspace wave triggers a security response, and the machinery in the planet began to rip apart the other planets in the solar system. The Hudson's crew assisted the Ya'Leth to eject their warp core, now resonating with the same subspace distortions as the planet.After escaping the Bacchus system, astronomers watched in horror and amazement as the entire Bacchus-3 system pulled itself apart, pulling inwards towards a singularity, and disappeared.
Hudson Log 2 - Orion Heist: Stardate 5557.6, Session: 3Admiral Banna Stoker sent the crew of the USS Hudson to recover a stolen Tilikaal artifact. The crew tracked the artifact down to the SS Tardigrade, an Orion trade ship, and convinced them to hand over the artifact before their Romulan liaison arrived. Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Stoker took the artifact to study further.
Hudson Log 3 - Phantoms Adrift: Stardate 5591.2, Session: 4While delivering an encrypted message from Captain Alder to Captain Skaarsen, a trusted friend of Alder's, Commander Lodge and Lieutenant Tiaun encountered an 50 year old derelict Starfleet starship drifting out of on ion Nebula. There, an unknown species attempted to escape the wreckage by disguising themselves as copies of Lodge and Tiaun. The two real officers escaped the derelict ship and delivered the message, leaving a report with Starfleet to take care of the derelict ship and the strange entities there.
Hudson Log 4.1 - The Pasqual Problem: Stardate 5697.6, Session: 5While preparing to perform a deep space scan of the Shackleton Expanse, the Hudson encountered a starfleet shuttle with Admiral Bana Stoker on board. Stoker ordered the Hudson to head directly towards the Pasqual system, which had previously been unscanned. There, an away team was sent to investigate Pasqual-1, an M-class planet with a thick electromagnetic field surrounding it.The planet was inhabited by a variety of intelligent humanoid people that appear to be of many different species, but without any sort of advanced technology. The away team, led by Commander Lodge and joined by Jolepo, Verid, Doctor Suvak, and Ensign Tak avoided contact with the locals. They got beamed off the planet after 24 hours with film photographs and recorded observations.
Hudson Log 4.2 - The Pasqual Problem: Stardate 5697.6, Session: 6The Hudson was attacked by a Klingon D7 battle cruiser, which demanded custody of Admiral Stoker. The Hudson barely managed to avoid any serious harm before disabling the Klingon ship. Captain Astrid Alder attempted to liaison with the Klingons, but they demanded death in combat and would not surrender. Commander Lodge and Doctor Suvok convinced the Klingon Captain to let them on board to tend to their wounded, based on giving the Klingons a fair fight.Back on the Hudson, Lt. Cmdr. Jolepo and Lt. Verid refitted an atmospheric probe to enter the electromagnetic field of Pasqual-1. While performing a sensor sweep of the obelisk there, the probe was uploaded with thousands of years of genetic survey results. Each survey was paired was an "genetic advancement attempt", the results and purpose of which are still unclear.
Hudson Log 5 - Aboard the Klingon Ship: Stardate 5697.6, Session: 7Sukav, Robert Lodge, Valerie, and Tak beamed aboard the IKR Ya'leth on the pretense of offering medical aid. Their real mission was to figure out what the Klingons wanted with Admiral Stoker. The Klingon crew members seemed to be as irritated and confused about the situation as the crew of the Hudson. Their captain had kept the purpose of their mission secret, much like Admiral Stoker. However, the captain of the Klingon ship was soon forced to admit he and Stoker were after a weapon of incredible power. As the Klingon Crew mutinied, the Hudson away team left to confront Stoker. The Admiral ordered the Hudson to destroy the Klingon ship, but captain Astrid Alder had Stoker arrested instead.
Hudson Log 6 - Border Dispute: Stardate 5764.8, Session: 8The USS Hudson was summoned to rescue the USS Nightingale, a Federation science vessel which had drifted unexpectedly into the neutral zone. There, a Romulan bird of prey was claiming the crewmembers as prisoners of war. The Hudson quickly engaged the Romulan warbird and nearly disabled it while an evacuation team attempted to get survivors off the Nightingale. In the end, a Romulan disguised as a Vulcan, named T'lek attempted to return to the bird of prey but was fired upon. When T'lek sought refuge on the Hudson, they were quickly found to be a spy and arrested. It's still unclear what information T'lek was trying to give to the Romulans.
Hudson Log 7 - Investigation: Stardate 5798.4, Session: 9With the Hudson docked for the duration of Admiral Banna Stoker's court martial trial, the crew took some time to collect information on the Tilikaal artifact and the effect it may have had the admiral. In the end, they found a subliminal message of mental domination embedded in the artifact's subspace distress signal. Meanwhile, Commander Lodge followed leads of civilian trade of Tilikaal artifacts and opened civilian passage to systems previously blocked by Admiral Stoker.
Hudson Log 8 - Court Martial: Stardate 5832, Session: 10Admiral Banna Stoker was put on trial for a court martial. Commander Robert H. Lodge lead the prosecution on the request of Captain Alder. Defense Attorney Samuel T Cogley.Ahead of the trial, Jolepo and Verid investigated some of Admiral Stoker's history on the station, in particular the discharge of her son, Avery, a science officer aboard Narendra Station. They discovered that Admiral Stoker had suspected a Starfleet coverup regarding the Tilikaal and used her position to conduct a private investigation into the Subspace frequencies in the Washboard and their origin.Lodge argued through witness testimony that the Admiral had acted recklessly with her authority, and her removal from command was necessary to avoid prime directive violation and potential flashpoints leading to war with the Klingons. Cogley argued that the Admiral had acted within her rights in the chain of command and according to Starfleet values to provide assistance to a people in need.Finally, when Lodge offered into evidence the fact that Stoker may have been telepathically manipulated through the Tilikaal artifact, the tribunal ruled to acquit Stoker of charges, but reassigned her to a position far away from the Shackleton Expanse where her condition can be monitored.
Hudson Log 9 - Convention: Stardate 5865.6, Session: 11Science Officer Kassandra Pruitt went missing while investigating some of the system survey data recovered from T'Lek. Since Starfleet suspected Romulan involvement, Starfleet organized a convention to lure Pruitt's abductors. The bait would be several more Starfleet officers with connections to T'Lek and Admiral Stoker from the USS Hudson.The Delegations from the Romulans, Klingons, Orions, and many Federation worlds were invited to demonstrate their scientific and technological advancements. The members of the Hudson followed several leads, including a few Orions and a Klingon thief.A human trader named Cyrano Jones was peddling a Tilikaal dagger at the convention, and caught he attention of a Romulan Sub-Commander named Thalvaek, and a couple Orions. However, Jolepo was able to buy the dagger from Jones first. This lead to a Romulan named Sarren to attempted kidnapping Jolepo, but was unsuccessful. In a gambit to find out more of the the Romulan plans and form a stronger relationship, Sukav met with subcommander Thal'vaek with an offer to sell a Tilikaal dagger. He was not seen at the convention again, but was given a tracking device that saw him brought into the Romulan Empire.
Hudson Log 10.1 - Abyss Station: Stardate 5899.2, Session: 12Attempting to rescue Sukav, the Hudson chased a Romulan bird of prey to a black hole with a neutronium lined space station and a singular rocky planet orbiting it. The planet had strange cultist gazing at the black hole waiting for the day it would "gaze back". The black hole was rotating to annihilate the planet with its radiation jets. On the strange alien station, an away team tried to rescue Sukav.After a week of watching Sukav's tracking device linger in Romulan space, he was suddenly moved past Narendra station and into the Shackleton Expanse. The Hudson gave chase, pushing it's warp nacelles to ride over the washboard effect and catch up to the Romulan bird of prey.They found the bird of prey at a system orbiting a black hole, dubbed the Omega Draconis system. There, they found single rocky planet with no atmosphere but a series of underground structures about approximately 300 life signs. There was also a large space station made of obsidian black neutronium. The Romulans had taken Sukav, Lt Pruitt, and two Starfleet ensign s into the alien space station.As the Hudson arrived, the black hole suddenly seemed to rotate. Massive high powered radiation jets moved to expel along the galactic plane. The planet, and all ~300 people on it, stood to be annihilated. One away team went down to the planet to start an evacuation, while another went into the space station to recover Sukav and hopefully find out what caused the block hole to change orientation.The team on the planet found a small group of pale humanoids with space travel capabilities but no warp capability. They spoke about how they had spent a very long gazing into the abyss waiting for the time when the abyss would gaze back at them. They seemed unconcerned about the radiation jets.Meanwhile, a rescue team infiltrated the alien space station. Inside, they found large and humanoid-shaped automatons and a series of passageways leading into the center of the station. At the center, they found the Romulans working in a control center and the Starfleet officers tied up in the middle of the room. The rescue team ambushed the Romulans and engaged in the firefight. Kyle Miller and Tizia were each wounded by disruptor fire, leaving only Verid to fend off the remaining 5 Romulans.
Hudson Log 10.2 - Abyss Station Part 2: Stardate 5899.2, Session: 13Verid and Sukav made the ultimate sacrifice to destroy Abyss Station, so that no one can use it again. On the planet, Nisha and Tak left the cultists on the service, unable to break them from their faith.On the planet, Nisha spoke to the colony's leader, Akkara and attempted to convince them to evacuate the planet. Tak quickly collected as much about this people as they could, to preserve the historical record. Although Nisha was able to provide ample evidence that the planet and everyone on it would be destroyed, Akkara's faith that the Abyss would spare them was too great. In the end, the black hole's radiation jets obliterated the planet after the Hudson's crew evacuated.Meanwhile, Verid, Sukav, Astrid, and Kyle Miller dispatched the Romulans. Astrid sustained severe disruptor burns but Sukav stabilized her. Verid and Sukav worked together to operate the station, which seemed to be controlling the black hole. The controls implied the black hole was capable of generating a wormhole, through with the black hole itself or the radiation jets would be able to annihilate anything at the coordinates. The Romulans had set the coordinates at the Klingon homeworld, Qo'Nos.Ultimately, Verid and Sukav resolved that the station had to be destroyed so that the Romulans, nor even the Federation, could return to it. Without a way to communicate with the Hudson, they stayed behind and used the controls to create a singularity inside the station itself. The new singularity engulphed the station, Verid, and Sukav. Season 2
Hudson Log 11.1 - Crystal Clear: Stardate 56030, Session: 14The Hudson encountered a strange crystalline starship, and attempted to remove a torpedo from it, but ended up causes more damage. When they returned to Narendra Station, they found over 100 years had passed during their time at the black hole. Several members decide to either leave Starfleet or transfer to new positions. They rest of the long lost crew of the Hudson would continue their adventures in the Shackleton Expanse.After Abyss Station was destroyed by a new singularity, the USS Hudson left the Omega Draconis system towards Narendra station. The Hudson held a vigil for the lost members of the crew, Verid and Sukav. On the way back to Narendra Station, they found the stars and systems around them had moved much further in time than anticipated, about 110 years.On the way back, the Hudson encountered a strange crystalline ship attempting to communicate through light. An away team with Robert Lodge, Jolepo, Tizia, and Nisha beamed aboard the starship. They found a crystalline species, who led them to a unidentified torpedo embedded into the crystal walls of the ship.The torpedo was still active, and the attempts to remove it went awry. Jolepo and Tizia evacuated out into space through a hole in the hull, while Robert and Nisha took cover behind a door. A large section of the starship shattered like glass, and it fled soon afterwards.The Hudson continued to Narendra station, where they found that much had changed. The alliance between the Federation had strengthened, but not without some strife. General Kargan was still in command of the station, now approaching almost 200 years old. He had limited and controlled exploration of the Shackleton Expanse over the last 100 years, fearing the fate of his old counterpart, Banna Stoker. Now, a new Admiral joined Kargan from the Federation: Admiral April Hebert.After welcoming the crew of the Hudson back to Narendra Station, April invited them to take some time off to find their new place in the world. Robert Lodge would go on to become a historian, looking into the events of the past 100 years. And Astrid Alder would take some time off to consider new options in Starfleet. In the meantime, Narendra Station would provide an interim commanding officer and supplementary crew along with a Galaxy Class starship named in the Hudson's honor.
Hudson Log 12 - Pasqual's Progress: Stardate 56052, Session: 15Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the new USS Hudson-B on a short survey mission aboard the Hudson's yacht. They visited Pasqual-1, and found the society there advancing rapidly though technological ages on their own. The people of Pasqual had embark on a century long project to go to space. An away team found a single neutronium obelisk left on the planet, which seemed to have some sort of influence on the people there.Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the USS Hudson on a survey mission aboard the captain's yacht, the USS Portland. They planned to visit Pasqual-1 on a routine survey mission, and follow that up with a visit to the Lilifas system.They found that the Pasqual-1 population had been speed-running their technological advancement. In just 110 years, they've reached the equivalent of earth's information age (already a time known for accelerated advances in technology.) After Jolepo expressed interest in visiting the planet, Captain Scriba agreed. Scriba, Jolepo, Jaro, and Delisle all went down, leaving Nisha and Tizia on the yacht.On the planet, the away team found a society with a singular focus: get into space. The people there had correctly deduced that the monoliths Starfleet removed we taken from them, and their entire culture had been driven to reach out to know what else was out there.The away team decided to find something like a library, and got directions to something the people there called repository. People there seemed to expect the away team to speak openly and constantly about what new projects and research they were working on. At the repository, the away team sought out information on the black neutronium monoliths that were removed from the planet over the last 100 years. What they found was a history of people quicky devising that someone from off world must have taken the obelisks, and that space-travel must be possible.In the repository, a weekly ideas-sharing session was held, where all in attendance were required to share their research and progress. In the middle of this atrium, a silo opened up, and one of the black monoliths rose up from below. Lieutenant Delisle felt a presence of malicious patience coming from within the silo. Jolepo scanned the area during the meeting and found a subspace signal with a some sort of sublimal messaging in it, similar to the artifact that influenced Admiral Banna Stoker 110 years ago.Jolepo presented on an energy-efficient waste-disposal system for a colony ship, which avoided any suspicion that they may be from off world. Once the meeting was over, the away team was able to find a place to be alone and beam off planet unnoticed.Before reporting back to Starfleet, the crew of the USS Portland also visited the second planet on their itinerary: Lilifas. Here, they did a survey on the pre-warp civilization below. Video footage revealed a species of centaur-like otter people with age-of-sail technology. While observing Lilifas, a tractor beam from the planet grabbed asteroid orbiting in a ring around the planet, and threw it towards the USS Portland. Lt. Nisha was able to dodge the rocks. The USS Portland then returned to Narendra station, with plans to recover the 1 monolith remaining on Pasqual-1.
Hudson Log 13.1 - Pasqual's Past: Stardate 56073, Session: 16Admiral Hebert gave Captain Scriba permission to make first contact with the people of Pasqual-1. There, the Pasqualese were in a frenzy trying to learn as much about Starfleet technology as possible. But in their extended visit, Jaro made a dark secret buried beneath the repository: A borg queen.Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Hebert and General Kargan met with the bridge crew of the USS Hudson to discuss what to do about the civilization on the Pasqual system. They decided, much to General Kargan's dismay, that the Federation would make first contact with the Pasqualese. Captain Scriba made this contact by connecting to the planet's global communications network and announcing the Hudson's presence and intentions of peace. The planet's activity spiked there was a frenzy of communications on the planet. But before long, the Pasquallese sent a delegation to meet with the crew of the Hudson.The delegation was amazed by Stafleet technology, particularly interested in their warp technology, transporters, and replicators. After introductions were made, Captain Scriba made arrangements to start sharing Federation technology with them as a gesture of peace.The Hudson stayed at the Pasqual system for an extended time, and the crew spent plenty of time on and around the planet communicating with an teaching the Pasqualese about what it's like to be in the Federation. Delisle in particular learned that the Pasqualese depended on their biological distinctiveness and diversity to surive, each person contributing to the whole. This led to a culture that strongly valued cooperation and sharing.Delisle also picked up aa constant feeling of anxiety from the people of Pasqual-1. As if they weren't telling the Hudson and crew everything.Meanwhile, Jaro was lead below the obelisk and met a borg queen, and told to repair the transwarp drive. There, he came face to face with some sort of Borg head in a jar. It awoke and said, "Greetings."
Hudson Log 13.2 - The Proto-Borg: Stardate 56091, Session: 17The crew of the Hudson learned that the org believed itself to be a creation of the Tilikaal. Thinking the Borg was too much of a threat, the crew killed the "Borg queen" and calledi n the Federation, who occupied the planet briefly to remove all possible borg and Tilikaal influence on the planet.Below the repository, Jaro spoke with the Borg, learning that it had arrived thousands of years ago and was forced to remain dormant while the planet's electromagnetic field was active. But in the past 100 years, it had awoken and was using the Tilikaal monolith to influence and guide to people of Pasqual-1.The Borg "Queen" talked about being a creation of the Tilikaal, and that its mission was to travel the stars in search of them. It claimed that once it found the Tilikaal, perfect beings, it could finally assimilate them to become as perfect as they are.After a great deal of debate and further investiation the Hudson's crew decided to kill the Borg queen. But the Borg queen controlled the assimilated skeletons left over in the small Borg ship and defended herself. When the last of the guard were neutralized, the Borg queen begged for it's life. But Jolepo executed it.Starfleet and a compliment of Klingon battleships arrived on Pasqual and occupied it. There was a full sweep of the planet and find and root out and Borg technology. It took weeks. The Tilikaal monolith was excavated and removed from the planet also.While the people of Pasqual-1 now had a great leap in technology, they were left with a disdain for the Federation.
Hudson Log 14 - The Qofuari Conundrum: Stardate 56107, Session: 18The Hudson responded to a distress call from a population of futurists on a planet where advanced technology was illegal to develop. After deliberating over the demands of the Prime Directive, the Hudson took many of the futurists aboard to bring back to Narendra Station.The Hudson responded to a distress call from a Pre-Warp at the Lilifas system. They got in touch with a group of local Qofuari calling themselves the Future Builders. They claimed they were being held captive on their planet because development of advanced technology was illegal, despite their ability to do so.The Hudson got in touch with the planet's local authorities and spent time learning about the Qofuari and their culture. They were a fairly tribal people, but had managed to enforce this law globally due to matching cultural values. The Qofuari had also been evolved from Tilikaal monoliths similar to the Pasqualese, but at some point had managed to disassemble the monoliths themselves. The existence of the monoliths seemed to have been impetus for the laws against technology in the first placeIn the end, the Hudson agreed to take aboard the Future builders and bring them back to Narendra Station, taking them away from their home planet.
Hudson Log 15 - Fading Sun: Stardate 56127, Session: 19The Hudson visited the starbase Epsilon 19, where energy parasites from a nearby star had caused several major explosions. The crew managed to restore power and capture or kill the parasites. An Orion woman named Helestia was arrested for stealing scientific equipment in the confusion.The Hudson was assigned to deliver scientific equipment the small Epsilon 19 starbase at the Osarin system. The Starbase was studying a fading star, where the energy seemed to be disappearing. While aboard the station, Captain Scriba, Jolepo, and Doctor T'Lor got dinner with the station's commanding officer, Commander Johansson. At dinner, they met an Orion woman named Helestia Baenor, who had brought a number of luxuries to the station as gifts to thank the officers for allowing her crew to rest at the station. Meanwhile, the Hudson left to go study the nearby starAfter getting a tour of the station, Scriba, Jolepo, and T'Lor were aboard a turbolift with station science officer Mosa, when the station suffered a massive explosion at several points. T'Lor was able to stabilize Mosa, and they all climbed the turbolift shaft to a medical bay. There, they discovered the source of triolic radiation emanating from the engineering section, the same radiation emanating from the nearby star.In engineering, they discovered Baenor had turned off power output to the rest of the station, which had inadvertently lead to the explosion. Scriba left to pursue and arrest her. On the station's nuclear fusion reactor, Jolepo found strange energy parasite creatures out of phase in time. He used his phaser to bring them back into phase and caught several of them, but others escaped into Jefferies Tubes. By this point, power was restored to the station, and security teams could be organized to hunt down these strange creatures. The station would later be given better shielding to prevent infection from the local start, where the Hudson had discovered the parasites breeding.Helestia Baenor was arrested and found with Starfleet science equipment aboard her ship. She claimed to be attempting to rescue the equipment and prevent it from becoming damaged in the exploding starbase. She would be brought to Narendra Station for trial.
Hudson Log 16.1 - Convoy SE-119: Stardate 56168, Session: 20The Hudson and Klingon ship Mupwl' escorted a convoy to a new colony location in the Shackleton Expanse. Along the way, the Mupwl' was disabled by subspace eddies and the convoy atted by pirated calling themselves "Vinshari"Both the Mupwl' and Hudson were in Narendra station undergoing minor refits, repairs, and maintenance. Akarra asked captain to help convince Kargan to approve a colonization effort in the Shackleton expanse. The Hudson would provide cover for the convpy along with Akkara's IKS Mupwl'. Kargan reluctantly agreed.Along the way, the convoy headed through a region of the Expanse with strange subspace eddies in the washboard. Unlike the usual background turbulence of the washboard subspace waves.In these eddies, the Mupwl' suffered a sudden explosion in one of their warp nacelles, and comms were disrupted by the eddies as well. While the Hudson tried to make contact and organize repair teams, two unidentified ships with sails and masts appeared on the sensors, seemingly being "behind" the subspace eddies.The unidentified ships demanded the Hudson and Mupwl' had over their warp cores because "Power is our right." and attacked soon after. On the viewscreen, the enemies identified themselves as Vinshari and had bright red skin, with collar bones that rose out of the skin and flanked their necks like cape collars.The Hudson positioned itself to protect the convoy ships, and the Vinshari ships deployed a dozen small single fighters. Commander Jaro as able to modulate the Hudson's shields to crush half the fighters in a subspace eddy, which also collapsed the eddy itself.One of the larger Vinshari ships attacked the disabled Mupwl' and another tried to deal with the Hudson, while the remaining small fighters maneuvered to intercept the freighters. The Vinshari ships had difficulty piercing the Hudson's shields with their physical ammunition. And have since maneuvered around them to focus on the freighters. The Hudson is equipped with dozens of shuttles. Some notable ones are listed below!

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar
